Package game_code

Class runGame

java.lang.Object
game_code.runGame
public class runGame
extends java.lang.Object
The command line version of the game
Author:
Klai

  • Field Details

    • game

      GameEnvironment game
      Setting up the game

    • end

      private boolean end
      A boolean used to check if the game has ended

    • sc

      public static java.util.Scanner sc
      A scanner. This is static and public so we don't have to create new scanners. Closing a scanner looking at the standard input closes the standard input as well. This ends up crashing the application if you want any more input. Creating a bunch of new scanners is using up more memory than necessary. So just use this one.

  • Constructor Details

    • runGame

      public runGame()

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Begins the game and determine if the game ends Displays the initialized status of the game

    • chooseAction

      public void chooseAction()
      prompts the player available actions to choose from player chooses from a list of numbered actions

    • Actions

      public void Actions​(int choice)
      The actions the player can perform. An integer is assigned to each action
      Parameters:
      choice - The player's choice of action in integer

    • islandProp

      public void islandProp()
      The view island Property action The player choose from a list of numbered islands, the properties of the island is then displayed

    • shop

      public void shop()
      The Shop action Player can choose to buy, sell or leave the shop by entering an integer

    • repair

      public void repair()
      The repair ship action in the Shop action Repairs the ship at the a cost

    • buy

      public void buy()
      The Buy action in the Shop action The player enters the integer assigned to an item to attempt an purchase

    • sell

      public void sell()
      The Sell action in the Shop action The player enters the integer assigned to an item to attempt sell it

    • setSail

      public void setSail()
      The setSail action The player can choose an island to sail to, and then choose a route to take. Only lets player travel if the ship if repaired.

    • ending

      public void ending()
      This method is ran when the game ends Displays the player's name, game duration, profit made and final score.

    • checkDays

      public boolean checkDays()
      Checks if all days have passed or the number of remaining days is not enough to sail anywhere.
      Returns:
      False if there is still time to make an action, True if there is no time.

    • checkCantSell

      public boolean checkCantSell()
      Checks if the player can not sell on this island
      Returns:
      False if the player can sell items, True if the player can not sell.

    • checkEco

      public boolean checkEco()
      Checks if the player has enough money to make an action, also checks if the player can sell goods and then make an action.
      Returns:
      True if the player can not sell and 1)do not have enough money to repair the ship. 2) do not have enough money to take any of the routes to another island, then sets end to true. Otherwise returns false.
